title: RRB Clerk Prelims: Reasoning (7th Dec Shift 2) #RA005

questions.text: Which element is 12th from the left end?
questions.solution: Based on the given series: T % 7 Q B @ 3 A M & 9 $ Z 8 R ! 6 # T 2 ^ K 9 L $ C. Counting 12th from left gives $. [Source: S1 Solution]

questions.text: How many digits are there in the series that are immediately followed by a symbol and preceded by letter?
questions.solution: The condition is Letter -> Digit -> Symbol. There is one such pair: T2^. [Source: S2 Solution]

questions.text: Which element is 4th to the right of the 3rd digit from left end?
questions.solution: 3rd digit from left is 9. 4th element to the right of 9 is R. [Source: S3 Solution]

questions.text: If all the symbols are dropped from the series, then which element is sixth from the left end?
questions.solution: Series without symbols: T 7 Q B 3 A M 9 Z 8 R 6 T 2 K 9 L C. 6th from left is A. [Source: S4 Solution]

questions.text: How many letters in the series are immediately preceded by a symbol and immediately followed by a letter?
questions.solution: Condition: Symbol -> Letter -> Letter. No such combination is found. [Source: S5 Solution]

questions.text: Who was born three persons after G?
questions.solution: Based on the arrangement: Mon-G, Tue-D, Wed-C, Thu-F, Fri-A, Sat-E, Sun-B. Three persons after G (Monday) is F (Thursday). [Source: S6 Solution]

questions.text: How many persons were born between E and F?
questions.solution: E is born on Saturday, F on Thursday. Person between them is A (Friday). Total 1. [Source: S7 Solution]

questions.text: Which of the following combinations is correct?
questions.solution: From the solution table, G is born on Monday. [Source: S8 Solution]

questions.text: Who was born on Sunday?
questions.solution: From the solution table, B was born on Sunday. [Source: S9 Solution]

questions.text: Which of the following statements is/are not true? I. Three persons was born before A. II. F was born on Thursday. III. No person was born between G and C.
questions.solution: I is false (4 born before A). III is false (D born between G and C). II is true. Thus, not true are I and III. [Source: S10 Solution]

questions.text: Statements: P < Q > J >= R = K < T < U. Conclusions: I. Q > T II. U > R
options: Either conclusion I or II is true
Neither conclusion I nor II is true
Both conclusions I and II are true
questions.solution: I. Q > T is False. II. U > R is True (as R = K < T < U). [Source: S11 Solution]

questions.text: Statements: A >= E > N = O <= S < G = I. Conclusions: I. E > G II. A < S
options: Either conclusion I or II is true
Neither conclusion I nor II is true
Both conclusions I and II are true
questions.solution: I. E > G is False. II. A < S is False. [Source: S12 Solution]

questions.text: In the word 'CHANGE', how many pairs of the letters have the same number of letters between them (both forward and backward direction) as in the English alphabet?
questions.solution: The correct answer is Two pairs. [Source: S13 Solution]

questions.text: If 'Service sector' is coded as 'ot qr' then what is the code for boost?
questions.solution: From the solution table, 'Service/Boost' is 'qr/yt'. If 'Service' is 'qr' (given in Q), then 'Boost' is 'yt'. [Source: S14 Solution]

questions.text: Which word is coded as 'pm rp'?
questions.solution: 'Goods' is 'pm' and 'New' is 'rp'. So 'pm rp' is 'New goods'. [Source: S15 Solution]

questions.text: Which of the following statement(s) is/are definitely correct?
questions.solution: 'Needs' is coded as 'vo'. [Source: S16 Solution]

questions.text: What is the code for 'Supply'?
questions.solution: 'Supply' is coded as 'ke'. [Source: S17 Solution]

questions.text: Which among the following is coded as 'That Utility'?
questions.solution: 'Utility' is 'ta', 'That' is 'lx'. Answer is 'ta lx'. [Source: S18 Solution]

questions.text: How is H related to B?
questions.solution: Based on family tree, H is the son of B. [Source: S19 Solution]

questions.text: How many female members are there in the family?
questions.solution: There are 5 female members. [Source: S20 Solution]

questions.text: If M is married to F, then how M is related to B?
questions.solution: M would be Brother-in-law to B. [Source: S21 Solution]

questions.text: Who among the following was born on 15 December?
questions.solution: According to the solution table, C was born on 15 December. [Source: S22 Solution]

questions.text: How many persons were born before D?
questions.solution: Before D (Sep 22), 3 persons were born: E, A, B. [Source: S23 Solution]

questions.text: F was born on which of the following date?
questions.solution: F was born on 22 December. [Source: S24 Solution]

questions.text: Four of the following five are similar in a certain manner and form a group, which among the following is not related to the group?
questions.solution: Except F-E, both persons in the pair were born adjacent to each other. [Source: S25 Solution]

questions.text: Who among the following was born immediately after A?
questions.solution: A born June 22. Immediately after is B (Sep 15). [Source: S26 Solution]

questions.text: Which of the following will be the next element in the given series: AC4 BD7 CE10 DF13 EG16 ?
questions.solution: Pattern: First letter +1, Second letter +1, Number +3. E->F, G->H, 16->19. Result FH19. [Source: S27 Solution]

questions.text: What is the direction of point B with respect to point H?
questions.solution: Based on diagram, B is North-east of H. [Source: S28 Solution]

questions.text: What is shortest distance between point H and point F?
questions.solution: Based on diagram, shortest distance is 5m. [Source: S29 Solution]

questions.text: Four of the following five are similar in a certain manner and form a group, which of the following is not related to the group?
questions.solution: F-D is the odd one out. [Source: S30 Solution]

questions.text: Statements: Only a few managers are leaders. All leaders are planners. Conclusions: I. Some managers are planners II. Some leaders are not managers
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Conclusion I follows. [Source: S31 Solution]

questions.text: Statements: Only a few crate are jug. No box is jug. Conclusions: I. All box are crate II. No box are crate
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Neither conclusion follows. [Source: S32 Solution]

questions.text: Statements: Only a few writers are poets. All poets are critics. Some critics are lecturers. Conclusions: I. Some writers are lecturers II. No writers are lecturers
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Either I or II follows. [Source: S33 Solution]

questions.text: Statements: Only a few chefs are bakers. Some bakers are cooks. No cooks are authors. Conclusions: I. Some chefs are cooks II. Some bakers are not authors
options: If either conclusion I or II follows
If neither conclusion I nor II follows
If both conclusions I and II follow
questions.solution: Only conclusion II follows. [Source: S34 Solution]

questions.text: In the word 'INTRODUCE', if the letters are arranged in alphabetical order from left, then which letter will be the 6th letter from left end?
questions.solution: INTRODUCE -> CDEINORTU. 6th letter is O. [Source: S35 Solution]

questions.text: Four of the following five are similar in a certain manner and form a group. Who among the following is not related to the group?
questions.solution: A sits in the middle (facing out) while others sit at corners (facing in). [Source: S36 Solution]

questions.text: What is the position of B with respect to H?
questions.solution: B is second to the left of H. [Source: S37 Solution]

questions.text: Who among the following sits immediate left of C?
questions.solution: F sits immediate left of C. [Source: S38 Solution]

questions.text: How many persons sit between G and E, when counted from the left of G?
questions.solution: Two persons sit between G and E counted from left of G. [Source: S39 Solution]

questions.text: Which among the following statement is true?
options: H and G are immediate neighbors
D sits second to the right of G
questions.solution: F sits opposite to H is the true statement. [Source: S40 Solution]
